content.body: yup. It‚Äôs always an adjective. And to somebody who isn‚Äôt already read-up on web-platform terminology, ‚Äúsame origin policy‚Äù more likely is going just be (mis)read as ‚Äúhaving an origin policy that is the same‚Äù ‚Äî rather than a ‚Äúpolicy that is about stuff that has the same origin‚Äù

content.body: I think so yeah. But the multiple-modifiers case is the case where it‚Ä¶ kind of all breaks down, and gets annoying.
I can see same-origin policy, but A and B have the same origin would be weird if it was "A and B have the same-origin".
annevk: the spec doesn't use that phrasing. It uses "A is same origin with B" which should be with hyphen
